edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface Editor<E extends ExerciseData>

Type Parameters:
E - ExerciseData that can be edited with the implementor
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidExerciseEditor
public interface Editor<E extends ExerciseData>

An implementor of this class knows how to edit and create ExerciseData suitable for parameterizing exercise instances for certain exercise-type.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Summary
 Component getView()
           
 void initialize(ResourceGiver localizer, E oldData, GeneralExerciseInfoEditor genExerInfoEditor, EditorMaterialManager materialManager)
          Iniates the editor.
 void registerSaveListener(ExerciseSaveListener<E> listener)
          Listeners registered through this method are called when the user prompts through GUI (getView()) that the exercise is ready for saving.
 

Method Detail

getView

Component getView()
Returns:
The GUI through which the user can edit an exercise instance

initialize

void initialize(ResourceGiver localizer,
                E oldData,
                GeneralExerciseInfoEditor genExerInfoEditor,
                EditorMaterialManager materialManager)
                throws ExerciseException
Iniates the editor. If called with null as oldData, the implementor creates a new default ExerciseData as the base for the object.

Parameters:
localizer - ResourceGiver making it possible to localize UI
oldData - ExerciseData object to be edited or null if new should be created
genExerInfoEditor - GeneralExerciseInfoEditor giving a means to edit certain general attributes common to all exercises and external to specific exercise-type
materialManager - EditorMaterialManager that gives a means to include file-materials as a part of certain exercise-instance
Throws:
ExerciseException

registerSaveListener

void registerSaveListener(ExerciseSaveListener<E> listener)
Listeners registered through this method are called when the user prompts through GUI (getView()) that the exercise is ready for saving. Listeners can then for example save the new ExerciseData instance to a XML-file by using ExerciseXMLHandler.

Parameters:
listener - ExerciseSaveListener to register
